New Records: Cleveland joins the 2015-16 Warriors as the only teams since 2000 to start a season 33-4 or better and is just the seventh team to do so in NBA history
Key Match Events: Darius Garland dropped 40 points and nine assists, including a lead-extending 3 with 40 seconds left to boost Cleveland's win streak to 12
Anthony Edwards went for 21 points, seven assists and one jaw-dropping jam as Minnesota pulled away from Orlando in a defensive duel for its third win in a row
Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder face the Knicks for the second time in eight days (7:30 ET)
Paolo Banchero had a full practice yesterday and feels'really good' for Orlando's game against the Bucks (7 ET, LP)
Post-Match Reflections: Cavs coach Kenny Atkinson on Garland postgame: 'He carried us. He single-handedly took over this game.'
SGA on the Knicks after the win: 'Very high-level team. They're where they are in the league for a reason.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockets got a big win, with Alperen Sengun (32 pts, 14 reb) and Jalen Green (27 pts, 4 3s) leading the way
The Heat got their revenge, outscoring the Jazz 29-22 in the 4th to pull out their second straight road dub
Others: The Magic hold fourth place in the East. Now, they'll look to climb even higher with Banchero leading the charge.
The third fan returns will be released on Thursday, Jan. 16, before voting concludes on Jan. 20. TNT will reveal the All-Star Game starters on Jan. 23.
